Entities.Name: Lesion
Entities.Definition: Indicates the presence of lesions and abnormalities in the colonoscopic findings.
Entities.Sample Data: 'several erosions' and 'shallow ulcer' noted in the terminal ileum

Entities.Name: Location
Entities.Definition: The specific anatomical site of the findings within the colon, such as ascending colon or rectum.
Entities.Sample Data: 'on the terminal ileum', 'ascending colon', 'distal descending colon'

Entities.Name: Number
Entities.Definition: Specifies the count of findings like lesions or polyps observed.

Entities.Name: Size
Entities.Definition: The size of the findings observed during the colonoscopy, noted in cm.

Entities.Name: Shape
Entities.Definition: Describes the shape of the lesions or findings, which can affect diagnostic and treatment decisions.

Entities.Name: Color
Entities.Definition: The color of lesions or findings noted during the colonoscopy.
Entities.Sample Data: Not explicitly provided in the sample data

Entities.Name: Negation
Entities.Definition: Indicates the absence of lesions, abnormalities, or tumor recurrence.
Entities.Sample Data: 'There was no evidence of tumor recurrence.'

Dataset.Name: Colonoscopy Reports
Dataset.Details: 280,668 colonoscopy reports used for developing NLP models, with 5,000 manually annotated for training and testing the model.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: Annotation of colonoscopy reports using the DOCCANO tool for labeling procedural information, findings, and other relevant clinical data. Annotations are based on domain expert review and predefined labels.
